contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox German Location |Art = Stadt |Wappen = Wappen_Unterschleißheim.png |image_photo = RathausUnterschleißheim6757-1000.jpg |image_caption = Town hall |lat_deg = 48 |lat_min = 17 | lat_sec=0 |lon_deg = 11 |lon_min = 34 | lon_sec=0 |Bundesland = Bayern |Regierungsbezirk = Oberbayern |Landkreis = Munich |Lageplan = Unterschleissheimlkrm.svg |Höhe = 473 |Fläche = 14.93 |Einwohner = 27557 |Stand = 2012-12-31 |PLZ = 85716 |Vorwahl = 089 |Kfz = M |Gemeindeschlüssel = 09 1 84 149 |Bürgermeister = Christoph Böck |Partei = [[Sozialdemokratische Partei Deutschlands|SPD]] |Website = [http://www.unterschleissheim.de www.unterschleissheim.de] }} '''Unterschleißheim''' is a town in [[Bavaria]], [[Germany]]. It is located about 10 km north of the city limits of [[Munich]], and has a population of 27,106 (December 31, 2007). ==History== Unterschleißheim was first mentioned in 785. During [[World War II]], a women's subcamp of [[Dachau concentration camp]] was located here.<ref>[http://www.edwardvictor.com/Holocaust/2006/Unterschleissheim.htm Edward Victor.'' Alphabetical List of Camps]</ref> The town's 1200th anniversary in 1985 incorporated the inauguration of the new town center with the Town Hall and Citizens Advice Bureau. On December 16th, 2000, Unterschleißheim was granted [[Town privileges|privileges of a town]], known as 'Stadtrecht' in German. Unterschleißheim's coat of arms symbolises the city's past and present. The shield of the coat of arms is divided. The upper part shows a golden zigzag line on a blue background. The lower part incorporates a green branch of a spruce and a green oak leaf on a golden background. <ref>[http://www.unterschleissheim.de/_Media/image/kultur/wappenCropped.gif Coat of Arms, Unterschleißheim]</ref> Unterschleißheim is the home of a corporate office of [[Adobe Systems]], as well as the headquarters of [[Microsoft]]'s subsidiary in Germany and for Eastern Europe. ==Recreation== Lake Unterschleißheim was created from 1979-1980 by extracting fill to build the Autobahn. Over the past 3 decades it has become an almost natural lake, with an ecologically balanced zone, a conservation area for seabirds during the nesting season, and a damp biotop covering {{convert|26|acre|m2}} of land, of which roughly {{convert|18|acre|m2}} is used for sunbathing. With numerous shallow areas this is a popular summer gathering area for families with children, and used frequently for ice skating and [[curling]] in the winter. ==Transport== Unterschleißheim is situated at the crossroads of two Autobahns, the [[Bundesautobahn_99|A99]] and A92, with direct routes to [[Stuttgart]], [[Nuremberg]] and the [[Munich Airport|Munich Airport Franz Josef Strauß]]. Two [[S-Bahn]] stations on the [[Munich–Regensburg railway|Munich–Regensburg line]], served by [[S1_(Munich)|S1]] trains, connect Unterschleißheim with the regional rail system. == [[Town twinning|Sister cities]] == * {{flagicon|France}} [[Le Cres]], [[France]] * {{flagicon|Germany}} [[Lucka]], [[Germany]] * {{flagicon|Hungary}} [[Zengoalja Kistekseg]], [[Hungary]] * {{flagicon|Russia}} [[Zelenograd]], [[Russia]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.unterschleissheim.de/ Official homepage of Unterschleißheim] (in German and English) {{Cities and towns in Munich (district)}} [[Category:Munich (district)]]
